intro: Ptilostemon chamaepeuce subsp. cyprius, commonly known as Cyprus rock-rose, is a flowering plant native to the island of Cyprus. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy flowers. The plant typically produces small, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to Mediterranean climates.
